mockSets.title: Mock Test 1: Fundamentals
mockSets.description: Prepare yourself for this assessment. Read the instructions carefully before starting.

questions.question: Which of the following is a fundamental right guaranteed under Article 21 of the Indian Constitution?

options.text: Right to life and personal liberty

questions.question: In contract law, what is the term for an offer that can be revoked at any time before acceptance?
What is the maximum punishment for murder under Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code?
Which principle states that a person is liable for harm caused by their negligence?
What is the doctrine of 'stare decisis'?
Under the Indian Evidence Act, which section deals with the burden of proof?
What is the legal term for a contract entered into by a minor?
Which writ is issued to prevent a person from doing something?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for recovery of debt?
Which article of the Indian Constitution deals with the right to freedom of religion?
What is the term for a person who makes a will?
Under which section of the IPC is theft defined?
What is the legal age of majority in India?
Which principle states that equity follows the law?

options.text: Equity will not suffer a wrong without a remedy
Equity imputes an intention to fulfill an obligation

questions.question: What is the term for a contract where both parties are bound to perform their obligations?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to constitutional remedies?
What is the doctrine of 'res ipsa loquitur'?
Under the Limitation Act, what is the period for filing a suit for specific performance?
What is the term for a person who receives property under a will?
Which section of the Indian Penal Code deals with criminal conspiracy?
What is the principle of 'caveat emptor'?
Which article of the Constitution provides for the right to equality?
What is the term for a contract that is valid but can be set aside by one party?
Under which section of the IPC is cheating defined?
What is the doctrine of 'ultra vires'?
Which writ is issued to command a public authority to perform its duty?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for breach of contract?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right against exploitation?
What is the term for a person who is appointed to manage the estate of a deceased person?
Under which section of the IPC is criminal breach of trust defined?
What is the principle of 'res judicata'?
Which article of the Constitution provides for the right to freedom of speech and expression?
What is the term for a contract where consideration is past?
Under which section of the IPC is defamation defined?
What is the doctrine of 'pari passu'?
Which writ is issued to produce a person before the court?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for recovery of immovable property?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to form associations?
What is the term for a contract that is not enforceable by law?
Under which section of the IPC is attempt to commit an offence defined?

mockSets.title: Mock Test 2: Advanced
mockSets.description: Prepare yourself for this assessment. Read the instructions carefully before starting.

questions.question: What is the doctrine of 'basic structure' in constitutional law?

options.text: A doctrine that limits the power of Parliament to amend the Constitution
A doctrine that expands the power of Parliament
A doctrine that limits judicial review
A doctrine that expands executive power

questions.question: In contract law, what is the difference between a condition and a warranty?

options.text: A condition is essential, a warranty is not
A warranty is essential, a condition is not

questions.question: What is the principle of 'mens rea' in criminal law?
Which tort requires proof of actual damage?
What is the doctrine of 'precedent'?

options.text: Previous decisions binding on future cases
Future decisions binding on previous cases
Decisions that have no binding effect

questions.question: Under the Evidence Act, which section deals with admissions?
What is the term for a contract where one party has already performed?
Which writ is issued to quash an order of a lower court?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for specific performance of a contract?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to move the Supreme Court?
What is the term for a will that is made orally?
Under which section of the IPC is robbery defined?
What is the legal age for marriage in India?

options.text: 18 years for female, 21 years for male

questions.question: Which principle states that equity will not assist a volunteer?

options.text: Equity will not assist a volunteer

questions.question: What is the term for a contract where only one party is bound?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to assemble peacefully?
What is the doctrine of 'volenti non fit injuria'?

options.text: To a willing person, no injury is done
To an unwilling person, injury is done

questions.question: Under the Limitation Act, what is the period for filing a suit for partition?
What is the term for a person who is entitled to receive property under a will?
Which section of the Indian Penal Code deals with abetment?
What is the principle of 'quantum meruit'?
Which article of the Constitution provides for the right to practice any profession?
What is the term for a contract that is against public policy?
Under which section of the IPC is forgery defined?
What is the doctrine of 'estoppel'?

options.text: A person is prevented from denying what they have previously stated
A person can deny what they have previously stated
A person must always state the truth
A person can never state anything

questions.question: Which writ is issued to inquire into the legality of holding a public office?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for damages for breach of contract?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to move freely?
What is the term for a person who is appointed to manage property for the benefit of another?
Under which section of the IPC is criminal intimidation defined?
What is the principle of 'actus reus'?
Which article of the Constitution provides for the right to reside and settle?
What is the term for a contract where consideration is inadequate?
Under which section of the IPC is criminal trespass defined?
What is the doctrine of 'laches'?

options.text: Unreasonable delay in asserting a right
Reasonable delay in asserting a right
No delay in asserting a right

questions.question: Which writ is issued to prevent an inferior court from exceeding its jurisdiction?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for possession of immovable property?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to form unions?
What is the term for a contract that is made under coercion?
Under which section of the IPC is attempt to commit suicide defined?

mockSets.title: Mock Test 3: Advanced Topics
mockSets.description: Prepare yourself for this assessment. Read the instructions carefully before starting.

questions.question: What is the doctrine of 'separation of powers'?

options.text: Division of government into three branches

questions.question: In contract law, what is the difference between fraud and misrepresentation?

options.text: Fraud requires intention to deceive, misrepresentation does not
Misrepresentation requires intention to deceive, fraud does not

questions.question: What is the principle of 'double jeopardy'?

options.text: A person cannot be tried twice for the same offence
A person can be tried twice for the same offence
A person must be tried twice
A person cannot be tried at all

questions.question: Which tort does not require proof of damage?
What is the doctrine of 'judicial review'?

options.text: Power of courts to review legislative and executive actions
Power of legislature to review judicial actions
Power of executive to review judicial actions

questions.question: Under the Evidence Act, which section deals with confessions?
What is the term for a contract where both parties are yet to perform?
Which writ is issued to command a lower court not to proceed with a case?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for recovery of money?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to move the High Court?
What is the term for a will that is written entirely in the testator's handwriting?
Under which section of the IPC is dacoity defined?
What is the legal age for entering into a contract?
Which principle states that equity will not suffer a wrong without a remedy?

options.text: Equity will not assist a volunteer
Equity will not suffer a wrong without a remedy

questions.question: What is the term for a contract where consideration moves from the promisee?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to freedom of trade?
What is the doctrine of 'contributory negligence'?

options.text: Plaintiff's own negligence contributing to the harm
Defendant's negligence contributing to the harm

questions.question: Under the Limitation Act, what is the period for filing a suit for recovery of possession?
What is the term for a person who is appointed to manage the affairs of a minor?
Which section of the Indian Penal Code deals with preparation to commit an offence?
What is the principle of 'unjust enrichment'?

options.text: Gaining benefit at another's expense without legal justification

questions.question: Which article of the Constitution provides for the right to form co-operative societies?
What is the term for a contract that is made under undue influence?
Under which section of the IPC is criminal breach of trust by a public servant defined?
What is the doctrine of 'promissory estoppel'?

options.text: A promise that cannot be revoked if relied upon
A promise that can always be revoked
A promise that is never binding
A promise that is always void

questions.question: Which writ is issued to transfer a case from a lower court to a higher court?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for recovery of movable property?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to acquire property?
What is the term for a person who is entitled to receive property by inheritance?
Under which section of the IPC is house-trespass defined?
What is the principle of 'vicarious liability'?

options.text: Liability for the acts of another

questions.question: Which article of the Constitution provides for the right to information?
What is the term for a contract where consideration is illegal?
Under which section of the IPC is mischief defined?
What is the doctrine of 'clean hands'?

options.text: A person seeking equity must come with clean hands
A person seeking equity can come with dirty hands

questions.question: Which writ is issued to command a person to show by what authority they hold an office?
What is the limitation period for filing a suit for recovery of debt secured by mortgage?
Which article of the Constitution deals with the right to form political parties?
What is the term for a contract that is made under mistake of fact?
Under which section of the IPC is attempt to commit dacoity defined?

mockSets.title: Mock Test 4: Constitutional Law
mockSets.description: Prepare yourself for this assessment. Read the instructions carefully before starting.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the concept being tested in this scenario?

options.text: This represents the first possible interpretation of the given scenario
This represents the second possible interpretation of the given scenario
This represents the third possible interpretation of the given scenario
This represents the fourth possible interpretation of the given scenario
